definition: Ensuring consistent voice, tone, and stylistic choices throughout a document or across multiple contributors

positive_examples: Style harmonization unified the tone across twelve different chapter contributors.
The editor harmonized the inconsistent levels of formality between sections.
Style harmonization smoothed the shift from conversational to technical voice mid-document.
Harmonizing style ensured the ghostwritten chapters matched the author's established voice.
Style harmonization reconciled the technical chapters with the narrative introduction into one voice.
training_hints.disambiguation: Deliberate unification of stylistic elements, not mere consistency checking
